description: A submission to request access to controlled data.

id.description: The unique immutable ID for this submission. A new ID will be generated for new Submission. Once issued, this ID is guaranteed to never change or be re-issued.

accessRequirementId.description: The ID of the Access Requirement which requires a request to be submitted to gain access to a dataset. This submission contains information that satisfies those requirements.

accessRequirementVersion.description: The version of the Access Requirement which requires a request to be submitted to gain access to a dataset. This submission contains information that satisfies those requirements.

requestId.description: The ID of the Request which is used to create this submission.

ducFileHandleId.description: The Data Use Certificate uploaded by user.

irbFileHandleId.description: The Institutional Review Board Approval document uploaded by user.

attachments.description: The set of file handle ID of attached files to this request.

accessors.description: The set of user ID who will gain access to the data set once the request is approved.

researchProjectSnapshot.description: The snapshot of the research project associated with this submission.

isRenewalSubmission.description: True if this submission is a renewal submission.

publication.description: Link(s) to publication that used the controlled data.

summaryOfUse.description: Summary of how the data has been used.

submittedOn.description: The date this submission was created.

modifiedOn.description: The date this submission was reviewed or was cancelled.

submittedBy.description: The ID of the user that submit this submission.

modifiedBy.description: The ID of the user that last modified the status of this submission.

rejectedReason.description: The reason this submission is rejected, if it's rejected.

etag.description: Synapse employs an Optimistic Concurrency Control (OCC) scheme to handle concurrent updates. Since the E-Tag changes every time a request is updated it is used to detect when a client's current representation of a request is out-of-date.
